lexUnit.name: maximum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the greatest amount, extent, or intensity possible or recorded.

sentence.text: It can be a maximum of 28 alphanumeric characters , including spaces and the special characters “ . ” ,
This represents a maximum of 1.25 kg per 25 kg bag .
THE law stipulates that on school days people under the age of 16 can work only a maximum of two hours .
The course was promoted by the Trustees and the National Education Committee with some nominal cost , and a maximum of ten participants .

It was this easy tone that had been in Sam 's voice when he had informed Brandt that Global Motors would , without question , destroy him and Imperial Oil within an absolute maximum of fifteen years .
Any longer than an absolute maximum of six , he argued , would run the risk of not being able to recapture viewers lost to an unpopular first episode .
The current maximum is one years ' pay and 18 months of medical coverage .
But will this prove a welfare maximum ?
An assimilation arrangement will apply to staff on spinal column points below their grade maximum .
Moreover , buggery of a woman still carries a maximum penalty of life imprisonment , whereas buggery of a male over 16 has a ten-year maximum .
Note , however , that you can only add a maximum of 10 modules to any one SPR .
Given that you have only two lines of text to play with , and therefore a maximum of two fonts to use , gloriously grotty font clashes are unlikely .
Canvassers who normally get the forms back after a maximum of four visits to any household are now having to return seven or more times before the people hand back the completed form .
General Manager Rogerson added : ` We are running more trains than ever with a maximum of 26 per day in the height of our season .
However there are many guides who run trips normally for a maximum of six people .
The maximum of silence with the maximum of noise .
Keep your stories to a maximum of 500 words .
The present practical maximum is about 12-13cm .
Hughes and Elner ( 1979 ) gave the favoured whelk size for a large Curcinus as I 4 mm , with the maximum at 27 mm .
